intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium pallescens subsp. pseudohittense, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It has yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, and its leaves are usually covered in fine hairs. This subspecies is distinguished by its pale green coloration and slightly smaller flower heads compared to other members of the species.
